get.description:
Get a list of all jobs. Filters can be applied using query parameters.
Number of results can be limited by page. Results are sorted by descending startTime.

parameters.description: Syntax: '$from-$to', as unix epoch timestamps in seconds
parameters.name: start-time

delete.description: Job to delete is specified by request body. All fields are required in this case.
delete.summary: Remove a job from the sql database

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: finding job failed: sql: no rows in result set

delete.description: Job to remove is specified by database ID. This will not remove the job from the job archive.
delete.summary: Remove a job from the sql database

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: finding job failed: sql: no rows in result set

delete.description: Remove all jobs with start time before timestamp. The jobs will not be removed from the job archive.
delete.summary: Remove a job from the sql database

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: finding job failed: sql: no rows in result set

post.description:
Job specified in request body will be saved to database as "running" with new DB ID.
Job specifications follow the 'JobMeta' scheme, API will fail to execute if requirements are not met.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The combination of jobId, clusterId and startTime does already exist

post.description:
Job to stop is specified by request body. All fields are required in this case.
Returns full job resource information according to 'JobMeta' scheme.
post.summary: Marks job as completed and triggers archiving

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: finding job failed: sql: no rows in result set

post.description:
Job to stop is specified by database ID. Only stopTime and final state are required in request body.
Returns full job resource information according to 'JobMeta' scheme.
post.summary: Marks job as completed and triggers archiving

parameters.description: stopTime and final state in request body
parameters.name: request

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: finding job failed: sql: no rows in result set

post.description:
Adds tag(s) to a job specified by DB ID. Name and Type of Tag(s) can be chosen freely.
If tagged job is already finished: Tag will be written directly to respective archive files.
post.summary: Adds one or more tags to a job

404.description: Job or tag does not exist

post.description:
Job to get is specified by database ID
Returns full job resource information according to 'JobMeta' scheme and all metrics according to 'JobData'.
post.summary: Get complete job meta and metric data

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: finding job failed: sql: no rows in result set

post.description:
Modifies user defined by username (id) in one of four possible ways.
If more than one formValue is set then only the highest priority field is used.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The user could not be updated

get.description:
Returns a JSON-encoded list of users.
Required query-parameter defines if all users or only users with additional special roles are returned.

parameters.description: If returned list should contain all users or only users with additional special roles
parameters.name: not-just-user

post.description: User specified in form data will be saved to database.

parameters.description: Managed project, required for new manager role user
parameters.name: project

delete.description: User defined by username in form data will be deleted from database.

startTime.description: Start Time of job as epoch
Start Time of job as epoch

stopTime.description: Stop Time of job as epoch

arrayJobId.description: The unique identifier of an array job

cluster.description: The unique identifier of a cluster

exclusive.description: Specifies how nodes are shared: 0 - Shared among multiple jobs of multiple users, 1 - Job exclusive (Default), 2 - Shared among multiple jobs of same user

id.description: The unique identifier of a job in the database

jobId.description: The unique identifier of a job

monitoringStatus.description: State of monitoring system during job run: 0 - Disabled, 1 - Running or Archiving (Default), 2 - Archiving Failed, 3 - Archiving Successfull

numHwthreads.description: NumCores         int32             `json:"numCores" db:"num_cores" example:"20" minimum:"1"`                                                             // Number of HWThreads used (Min > 0)

partition.description: The Slurm partition to which the job was submitted

project.description: The unique identifier of a project

subCluster.description: The unique identifier of a sub cluster

user.description: The unique identifier of a user

walltime.description: Requested walltime of job in seconds (Min > 0)

schema.JobMeta.description: Meta data information of a HPC job.

arrayJobId.description: The unique identifier of an array job

cluster.description: The unique identifier of a cluster

exclusive.description: Specifies how nodes are shared: 0 - Shared among multiple jobs of multiple users, 1 - Job exclusive (Default), 2 - Shared among multiple jobs of same user

id.description: The unique identifier of a job in the database

jobId.description: The unique identifier of a job

monitoringStatus.description: State of monitoring system during job run: 0 - Disabled, 1 - Running or Archiving (Default), 2 - Archiving Failed, 3 - Archiving Successfull

numHwthreads.description: NumCores         int32             `json:"numCores" db:"num_cores" example:"20" minimum:"1"`                                                             // Number of HWThreads used (Min > 0)

partition.description: The Slurm partition to which the job was submitted

project.description: The unique identifier of a project

startTime.description: Start epoch time stamp in seconds (Min > 0)

subCluster.description: The unique identifier of a sub cluster

user.description: The unique identifier of a user

walltime.description: Requested walltime of job in seconds (Min > 0)

schema.Resource.description: A resource used by a job

accelerators.description: List of of accelerator device ids

configuration.description: The configuration options of the node

schema.Tag.description: Defines a tag using name and type.

id.description: The unique DB identifier of a tag
